intro: Monocarpia euneura, commonly known as the narrow-leafed monocarp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Monocarpia euneura is a shrub that grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters.
